description.text: Restores a small amount of Health. Try to combine these into something Mega-better!
Restores a moderate amount of Health. This potion is a hunter's best friend.
Very slightly increases your maximum Health level.
Slightly increases your maximum Health level.
Removes all traces of poison from your system.
Boosts your natural ability to heal.
Lets you run without tiring for a short time.
Lets you run without tiring for longer than with regular Dash Juice.
Boosts your Attack by filling you with -- guess what? -- demonic strength.
Boosts your Attack even more than a regular Demondrug.
Temporarily endows you with the strength of a mighty god. Potent!
Boosts your Defense by turning your skin as hard as rock.
Boosts your Defense even more than a regular Armorskin.
Boosts your Defense even more than a regular Armorskin.
Provides temporary relief from extreme heat.
Provides temporary relief from extreme cold.
Immediately removes any ice or mud on your body. Clean as a whistle!

ailmentcure.text: Cures Snowman, Muddy, Webbed and Tarred.

description.text: An item that cures Soiled. Releases a puff of deoderizing smoke when thrown down.
Temporarily sharpens your sixth sense and attunes you to the ways of monsters.
Removes all traces of poison and restores a slight amount of Health.
Fully restores health and increases your maximum Health level all the way.
Fully restores Health and Stamina, and raises the max levels of both all the way.
Works with other materials to enhance their effects. Cannot be used by itself.
This bottle is all you'll need to wake up! Shakes off sleep and restores Stamina.
A dangerous substance that explodes when struck or heated.
Mysterious crystals long worshipped as a source of life.
A Lifecrystal combination used as medicine. Heals with a single touch.
A medicine with strong curative properties. Studied in secret, it is said to restore youth.
Medicine that works as an anesthetic when combined.
A modest good-luck charm. What does it do? Finish the Quest and you'll find out.
A curious good-luck charm. What does it do? Finish the Quest and you'll find out.
A powerful good-luck charm. What does it do? Finish the Quest and you'll find out.
An amulet that raises Attack. Just carrying this gives you demonic strength.
A powerful amulet that raises Attack. Made with a Deviljho Talon.
An amulet that raises Defense. Just carrying this hardens your skin like rock.
A powerful amulet that raises Defense. Made with a Deviljho Talon.
Meat carved from a monster. Can be cooked, combined, or use to set a trap.
Raw Meat that poisons whatever eats it. Makes great bait for traps.
Raw Meat that paralyzes whatever eats it. Makes great bait for traps.
Raw Meat that puts whatever eats it to sleep. Makes great bait for traps.
Provides a small boost to your Stamina. This one's still red in the middle.
Provides a moderate boost to your Stamina. Meat done right!
Meat that has been burnt to a crisp. It might boost your Stamina, or it might drain it...
Meat that cools the body, wards off heat, and boosts a moderate amount of Stamina.
Meat that warms the body, wards off the cold, and boosts a moderate amount of Stamina.
An unusually-shaped weapon from abroad that returns to its user when thrown.
A standard throwing knife. Flies straight and true.
A throwing knife with a venom-coated blade. Poisons targets.
A throwing knife whose blade has been dusted with sleeping agents.
A throwing knife coated with toxins that paralyze a target.
A throwing knife used for capturing monsters ensnared in traps.
A base material for making hand-thrown bombs.
Toss this scented paint at a monster to mark it, allowing you to track its position.
Flashes brightly on impact. Toss this right under a monster's nose to blind it.
A grenade-like item that emits a high frequency blast of sound on detonation.
That's right: monster poop. The odor reveals too much much about the monster's diet.
Releases an odor monster find repulsive. It may even drive them away... or not.
Creates a large cloud of smoke wherever it lands.
Instantly transports you back to base camp.
A hand grenade used to capture monsters ensnared in traps.
A very sticky web.
A sturdy net able to support a certain amount of weight without breaking.
A tool you'll need to put a Pitfall Trap or other traps together with.
Activates when something heavy walks across. use this to capture monsters.
Immobilizes a target. You can use this to capture monsters.
How many whiffs does it take to find out what as in this empty barrel? Just one!
How many licks does it take to find out what was in this empty barrel? Just one!
A small time bomb. You can use it underwater.
A powered-up Barrel Bomb S. Small, but it packs a punch. You can use it underwater.
A potent bomb that detonates on impact. Waterproofed, so it still works underwater.
A powered-up Barrel Bomb L. Deadly. Waterproof, so it still works underwater.
An improved version of the Bounce Bomb. Requires some skill to use.
Emits a scent Felynes love. Try hitting monsters with it.
A berry that is hollow on the inside.
Non-specialized ammo. More powerful than Lv1.
Non-specialized ammo that richochets, resulting in high damage.
Armor-piercing ammo that deals multiple hits to some monsters.
Armor-piercing ammo. Higher-level ammo deals additional hits.
Armor-piercing ammo. This highest level deals the most hits.
Ammo that his a wide area. Deals multiple hits at close range.
Ammo that hits a wide area. Higher-level ammo deals additional hits.
Ammo that hits a wide area. This highest level deals the most hits.
Powerful ammo that lodges in a target, then explodes.
Very powerful ammo that lodges in a target, then explodes.
Extremely powerful ammo that lodges in a target, then explodes.
Fragments into three shells upon impact. Beware of friendly fire!
Fragments into four shells upon impact. Beware of friendly fire!
Fragments into five shells upon impact. Beware of friendly fire!
Ammo that packs extra punch against monsters susceptible to Fire.
Ammo that packs extra punch against monsters susceptible to Water.
Ammo that packs extra punch against monsters susceptible to Thunder.
Ammo that packs extra punch against monsters susceptible to Ice.
Mysterious ammo that won't work in regular bowguns.
Ammo dipped in poison. Some targets require multiple shots.
Ammo dipped in deadly poison. Some targets require multiple shots.
Ammo that causes paralysis. Some targets require multiple shots.
Ammo that paralyzes quickly. Some targets require multiple shots.
Ammo containing a sleeping agent. Some targets require multiple shots.
Ammo packed with sleeping agents. Some targets require multiple shots.
Special ammo that drains monsters' stamina.
Enhanced special ammo that drains monsters' stamina.
Special ammo that ejects sharp blades on impact. Can it sever tails?
Ammo patterned after Wyvern's Fire. Not as potent, but can be rapid-fired.
Ammo that restores a small amount of Health to the target.
Ammo that restores a moderate amount of Health to the target.
Ammo that fills the target with savage amounts of strength.
Ammo that hardens the skin, guarding against attacks and Wind Pressure.
Ammo that marks a monster's position on your Map for a limited time.
Bowgun ammo used to capture monsters ensnared in traps.
A regular old empty phial.
An arrow coating that increases the Attack of arrows fired. Capacity 50.
An arrow coating that increases close-range power and melee Sharpness. Capacity 20.
An arrow coating that applies Poison effects to arrows fired. Capacity 20.
An arrow coating that applies Paralysis effects to arrows fired. Capacity 20.
An arrow coating that applies Sleep effects to arrows fired. Capacity 20.
An arrow coating that causes arrows fired to drain monsters' stamina. Capacity 20.
An arrow coating that marks a monster's position on the map for a limited time. Capacity 99.
A fishing lure. Wriggles underwater, enticing those fishies to bite.
A fishing lure. Causes a feeding frenzy. No fish can resist this one!
Know any monsters good at fishing? Try fighting fire with fire.
A fishing lure with chum that makes Sushifish go "mmm".
A fishing lure with chum that makes fish that rupture on death go "mmm".
A fishing lure with chum that makes Goldenfish go "mmm".
A cheap pickaxe with an easily nicked blade.
A pickaxe with a reasonably strong blade.
A pickaxe tempered with steel. This one won't nick easily.
A cheap net for catching bugs. it tears easily.
A durable net for catching bugs.
An extremely durable net for catching bugs. This one is made t olast.
Just what you need to cook meat. A must-have item for any hungry hunter.
A standard-sized Whetstone. Use it to restore a weapon's Sharpness.
Allow you to see farther and observe from a distance.
Junk created when a combination attempt fails.
Used to attract certain monsters - blow at your own risk. May break when used.
Restores Health to those who hear it. May break when used.
Eliminates poison in the blood of those who hear it. May break when used.
Increases the strength of those who hear it. May break when used.
Bolsters the defenses of those who hear it. May break when used.
Full of nutrients, but indigestible in this form.
Restores a very small amount of Health, but the flavor's not too hot.
A plant used in antidotes. Sometimes cures poison when eaten by itself.
A wondrous, flammable plant.
A vine of tough fibers. Woven, it is sturdy enough to hold a person's weight.
A plant containing sleeping agents.
The sap it secretes is a strong adhesive. Careful you don't glue your pouch shut!
Melynxes' favorite food -- they just have to steal it.
A night-blooming flower from a special herb native to Moga. It may have healing properties.
Blazingly spicy. Sure, it'll warm you up, but it's too hot to handle on its own.
A well-known combo material used to augment power. The deeper the blue, the better.
A hard-to-find mushroom with the power to generate blazing heat.
A mushroom that induces paralysis.
Logic says not to eat this poisonous fungus, but don't write it off completely.
Thie one has a very strange aroma... Edible? Only one way to find out.
A dangerous fungus said to suck the life out of the one who plucks it. Beware.
A berry with a shocking hue and an overwhelming scent. Look out: It WILL stain!
Temporarily raises your Attack when ingested by improving energy flow.
Temporarily raises yoru Defense when ingested by hardening tissue.
A berry with a shocking hue and an overwhelming scent. Look out: It WILL stain!
A mysterious berry that cures all elemental Blights.
Eat this to cure Dragonblight and temporarily increase Dragon Resistance.
A nut that violently ejects its contents when struck.
A berry covered with needle-like thorns.
A berry that explodes when struck.
A trendy orange pumpkin. If left undisturbed, it can grow to gigantic proportions.
A rock with just the right heft for throwing. Tried and tested!
Ore with high iron content. Can be smelted and forget into various equipment.
Crystallized microbes which are prized as an abrasive when forging weapons.
An ore harder than iron, but also several times more difficult to forge with.
An ore that yields metal superior to that of Machalite. Rare and valuable.
An extremely hard substance with a faint glow. Sometimes used for cragting tools.
Ice that will note melt at room temperatures. Can be used to create denser ore.
Combusts even at room temperature. Its high heat can be used to fuse materials.
An extremely hard substance with a faint glow. Sometimes used for cragting tools.
An ore still being researched. It yields even better metal than Dragonite.
An ore composed of a mysterious metal, capable of fusing nearly any two materials together.
A promising new ore that produces higher quality metal than Carbalite Ore.
An ore composed of a durable, flexible metal that works well as a combining agent.
A magma-like deposit that only trained hands can properly work with.
An ore that blazes with an all-consuming flame. Requires considerable skill to mine.
A crystal that's 100% pure. Hard enough to be used in workshop tools.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Combine with other materials to create coating for armor.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Fuse this to armor to increase its strength.
Fuse this high-quality Armor Sphere to existing armor to increase its strength.
An advanced Armor Sphere. Rare in Moga Village. Save it for that special upgrade.
A thick, dense Armor Sphere. Use this precious rarity to push equipment to the limit.
A thick, dense Armor Sphere. Use this precious rarity to push armor to the limit.
An Armor Sphere of near-perfect purity. Its abilities require advanced techniques to extract.
An Armor Sphere with secret power that a true master can harness to upgrade gear.
An Armor Sphere with so much power that all but the most gifted craftsmen keep away.
A fish with a dorsal fin hard enough to sharpen weapons with.
A fatty, delicious fish that restores a small amount of Health when consumed.
A fish that contains sleeping agents.
A fish with jaws covered in tiny, needle-like spikes.
A fish that literally pops when it dies.
A fish that dashes itself to pieces when it dies.
A fish that burts open when it dies.
A fish that explodes when it dies.
A fish that eats anything -- allowing you to somtimes get items from its stomach.
A rare fish that commands a high price, but beware its ferocity, rookies!
A fish that can induce exhaustion.
A fish that emits blue light. Its sharp body will cut you to pieces if you're not careful.
The remains of an insect. You must be one hardcore collector to hang onto this!
A grasshopper with a foul odor. Make fishing lures with it; its scent drives explosive fish wild.
An unusual larva. Make fishing lures with it; its scent drives Goldenfish wild.
An insect said to live 1000 years -- but no one's lived long enough to prove it.
Boosts your natural ability to heal when eaten. It also cures poison... sometimes.
A nocturnal insect sometimes found in daylight. They emit a bright flash upon death.
Releases an electric shock when struck. Used to light rooms and start fires.
The insect's hard shell is often used as an abrasive.
Said to be the world's strongest bug. Use in forging, cooking, and more.
Thunderbugs which have been stimulated by Zinogre. They emit a pale blue light.
A rare and valuable insect that greatly assists in the bonding of metals.
A grasshoper with an exceptionally strong shell. Prized as a crafting material.
A butterfly with shimmering wings. So rarely seen in the wild, many believe it to be a myth.
A strange insect with the large jaws of a beetle and the delicate wings of a butterfly.
A hunk of rock? No, it seems to be metal... With a little polish, it could be more.
A fossil? No, it seems to be metal... With a little polish, it could be more.
A uniquely shaped metal fragment covered in rust. It looks like it could be used for something.
A map of the hunting ground.
Restores a tiny bit of Health. It does a body... sort of good!
Slightly boosts current/max Stamina. Most hunters agree: it's gross.
A Guild-provisioned BBQ Spit useful for novice hunters.
A portable Whetstone you can use to sharpend weapons.
Immobilizes a target for easy capture.
A grenade-like bomb that flashes brightly on impact.
A powered-up Barrel Bomb L (as potent as a B. Bomb L+). OK underwater.
Ammunition for a large mounted Bowgun.
Ammunition for a large mounted Bowgun. Keep giants from moving!
Special ammunition for an anti-dragon cannon. Not fun to lug around.
A small time bomb that sticks to targets.
Use this to light up dark places and stave off certain monsters.
Deliver to end the Quest. Maybe the Felynes will take you home...
A pinky-sized mushroom valued for its unusual aroma.
The perfect shape and aroma. Even better than a Unique Mushroom.
A unique Mushroom made more unique by maturing its aroma and flavor.
A rare fish made of solid gold. Sell it for a tidy sum.
A beetle with a jewel-like gleam. Prized by bug fans of all ages.
A unique bone prized in the village for reasons unknown.
Is this crimson stone the relic of some ancient beast?
Monster innards galore. A prized delicacy.

description.tex: Popo Tongue are popular, healthy, and fun to eat.

description.text: An egg taken from a flying wyvern's nest. Very fragile, so handle with care.
An egg stolen from a herbivore's nest. It looks pretty tasty.
A rock that explodes with even the slightest jolt. Careful!
Mysterious tears wept only on special occasions.
